node.title: Writers Guild Nominations: ‘Don’t Look Up,’ ‘Licorice Pizza’ and More
node.alt: Leonardo DiCaprio and Jennifer Lawrence in “Don’t Look Up,” with a screenplay by Adam McKay.
node.description: The group’s contenders can be predictive of the Oscars but several films, including “Belfast” and “The Power of the Dog” weren’t eligible.
node.content: ["The path to the best-picture Oscar almost always winds its way through the screenplay categories, so Thursday\u2019s feature-film nominations from the Writers Guild of America could clarify the top contenders of this awards season.", "But the list does come with some caveats. The organization has narrow requirements for eligibility that exclude films not written under a bargaining agreement from the WGA or its sister guilds, which is why you won\u2019t see nominations for \u201cBelfast\u201d and \u201cThe Power of the Dog,\u201d two movies that are hotly tipped as Oscar front-runners in the screenplay categories. Other ineligible films include \u201cThe Lost Daughter,\u201d \u201cPassing,\u201d \u201cCyrano\u201d and international contenders like \u201cA Hero,\u201d \u201cDrive My Car\u201d and \u201cParallel Mothers.\u201d", "With all that said, which films did make it in? The original-screenplay category is filled with previously nominated WGA favorites like Aaron Sorkin (\u201cBeing the Ricardos\u201d), Adam McKay (\u201cDon\u2019t Look Up\u201d), Paul Thomas Anderson (\u201cLicorice Pizza\u201d), and Wes Anderson (\u201cThe French Dispatch\u201d), with Zach Baylin\u2019s script for \u201cKing Richard\u201d rounding out the race.", "In the adapted-screenplay category, three big-budget films were recognized: \u201cDune,\u201d written by Jon Spaihts, Denis Villeneuve and Eric Roth; \u201cWest Side Story,\u201d by Tony Kushner; and \u201cNightmare Alley,\u201d by Guillermo del Toro and Kim Morgan. They\u2019ll compete against Sian Heder\u2019s script for her film \u201cCODA\u201d and \u201cTick, Tick \u2026 Boom!\u201d by Steven Levenson.", "Winners of the WGA Awards will be announced during a ceremony on March 20. Here is the full list of nominations.", "Original Screenplay", "\u201cBeing the Ricardos,\u201d Aaron Sorkin", "\u201cDon\u2019t Look Up,\u201d Adam McKay", "\u201cThe French Dispatch,\u201d Wes Anderson", "\u201cKing Richard,\u201d Zach Baylin", "\u201cLicorice Pizza,\u201d Paul Thomas Anderson", "Adapted Screenplay", "\u201cCODA,\u201d Sian Heder", "\u201cDune,\u201d Jon Spaihts, Denis Villeneuve and Eric Roth", "\u201cNightmare Alley,\u201d Guillermo del Toro and Kim Morgan", "\u201cTick, Tick \u2026 Boom!,\u201d Steven Levenson", "\u201cWest Side Story,\u201d Tony Kushner", "Documentary Screenplay", "\u201cBeing Cousteau,\u201d Mark Monroe and Pax Wasserman", "\u201cExposing Muybridge,\u201d Marc Shaffer", "\u201cLike a Rolling Stone: The Life & Times of Ben Fong-Torres,\u201d Suzanne Joe Kai"]
